page.title: 11TRANSPORT = TRAINS
page.content: West Horndon has a railway station which was built in 1866.The trains go to Southend then to London,Fenchurch Street.It is quite expensive to travel by train.A train goes through every 15 minutes, half-hourly in each direction. During the rush hour there are more trains. recently the train service has increased by two additional trains. A yearly season ticket costs Â£726 and 200 people from West Horndon have yearly season tickets.An ordinary return to London costs Â£4.80.A cheap day return to London costs Â£2.80. Three people work at West Horndon station.Two of the people work shifts the other person is a clerk.
